# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/models/wheel.py
@source-hash: 39d73535558be4df
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:31Z

## Primary Purpose
Represents a Python wheel file and provides parsing/validation of wheel filenames according to PEP 425/427 standards. Enables compatibility checking against supported platform tags.

## Key Components

### Wheel Class (L13-93)
Core class representing a wheel file with parsed metadata:

**Attributes:**
- `wheel_file_re` (L16-21): Regex pattern for parsing wheel filename components (name, version, build, python version, ABI, platform)
- `filename` (L30): Original wheel filename
- `name` (L31): Package name (underscores normalized to hyphens)
- `version` (L34): Package version (underscores normalized to hyphens) 
- `build_tag` (L35): Optional build tag
- `pyversions` (L36): List of supported Python versions
- `abis` (L37): List of supported ABIs
- `plats` (L38): List of supported platforms
- `file_tags` (L41-43): Set of all Tag combinations from the wheel

**Methods:**
- `__init__(filename)` (L23-43): Parses wheel filename, raises InvalidWheelFilename if invalid
- `get_formatted_file_tags()` (L45-47): Returns sorted list of tag strings
- `support_index_min(tags)` (L49-65): Finds lowest index of wheel's tags in priority list, raises ValueError if no match
- `find_most_preferred_tag(tags, tag_to_priority)` (L67-86): Returns priority of best matching tag using priority mapping
- `supported(tags)` (L88-93): Boolean check if wheel is compatible with any given tags

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging.tags.Tag`: PEP 425 tag representation
- `pip._internal.exceptions.InvalidWheelFilename`: Exception for malformed wheel names
- `re`: Regex matching for filename parsing

## Architecture Notes
- Follows PEP 425/427 wheel naming conventions
- Normalizes underscores to hyphens in name/version per wheel spec
- Uses Cartesian product of pyversions × abis × platforms for tag generation
- Two tag matching strategies: index-based (linear scan) and priority-based (hash lookup)
